formattedAddress: 201 E Randolph St (btwn Columbus Dr & Michigan Ave)

tips.text: Cloud Gate is a three-story steel sculpture that has been dubbed "The Bean" by Chicagoans, because of its legume-like shape. The sculpture is the first public artwork in the United States by world-ren
Ganji’s massive miche is crusty and cakey; his cranberry-walnut loaf makes the world’s best toast. The best part of this great bread? We hear PQM also sells some meats to go with it.

location.crossStreet: btwn Lake Shore Dr & Canal St
formattedAddress: Chicago River (btwn Lake Shore Dr & Canal St)

tips.text: Promenade on Chicago's newest waterfront playground: The Chicago Riverwalk. Ice cream, river tours, wine bars, bike rentals, restaurants and more. Plus,Thursday specials at participating businesses!
Enchilada with a Fried Egg was awesome, so was the Pozole.

formattedAddress: Millennium Park (btwn Columbus Dr & Michigan Ave)

tips.text: The trellis supports the sound system, which spans the 4,000 fixed seats and the Great Lawn, which accommodates an additional 7,000 people.

formattedAddress: 111 S Michigan Ave (btwn Monroe St & Jackson Dr)

tips.text: The collection encompasses more than 5,000 years of human expression from around the world & more than 260,000 pieces. The Modern Wing was opened in 2009 & is the largest expansion in their history.
Chicago: Any park that plays host to a Barack Obama victory speech and a Radiohead show in the same year deserves to be at the top of this list. -IFC Viewer
Don't miss the chef demos! Every Wed. and Sat. at 10:30am...see some of the city's finest in action.

formattedAddress: Michigan Ave (btwn Randolph St & Monroe St)

tips.text: If you like art and/or architecture don't miss The Bean in Millenium Park. It is truly fantastic!

formattedAddress: Lake Michigan Lakefront (at N Lakeshore Dr)

tips.text: The best way to see the city skyline. Run, walk or bike along this 18-mile trail along Lake Michigan in the summer, spring, fall and winter (if you can brave those Chicago temperatures).

formattedAddress: 2051 N California Ave (at N Point St)

tips.text: Don't overlook the coffee (Bang Bang roasts its own), the insane biscuits (with a spread of housemade jams & butters) or the huge yard, strung with lights & filled with picnic tables & lush greenery.

formattedAddress: 2537 N Kedzie Blvd (btwn Linden & Logan Sq.)

tips.text: Stop by on Mondays for the three-course $28 farm menu.

formattedAddress: 1616 N Wells St (btwn Concord Ln. & North Ave.)

tips.text: Chicago: A training ground for the likes of Tina Fey, Amy Poehler, Steve Carell and others, this legendary comedy club now boasts -IFC Staff

formattedAddress: 1462 N Milwaukee Ave (at N Honore St)

tips.text: This cafe's decor lovingly pays homage to pop culture gone by, w/ knicknacks like a Castle Grayskull strewn about, a real DeLorean parked in the front window, & an old TV hooked up to an Atari 5200.

formattedAddress: 3404 N Southport Ave (at W Roscoe St)

tips.text: Extra creamy and creatively flavored, Jeni's has a remarkably ability to make other ice cream seem one dimensional—like it's missing something.
Pick up a growler (but don’t be one!) from Half Acre’s first very own storefront w/ local microbrews. Stay tuned to Thrillist for frequent in-store tasting events & limited releases of choice beers

formattedAddress: 3733 N Southport Ave (btwn Grace St & Waveland Ave)

tips.text: The Music Box plays a mix of independent and foreign films, as well as classic (black and white) movie matinees, and midnight screenings of cult classics.

formattedAddress: 5148 N Clark St (at W Foster Ave)

tips.text: Check out the roasted chicken with oven-roasted artichokes, spring onions and mashed potatoes or a CB&J: a grilled sandwich of housemade cashew butter, fig jam and Morbier cheese on sourdough bread.

location.crossStreet: btwn W Dickens Ave & W Armitage Ave
formattedAddress: 2024 N Halsted St (btwn W Dickens Ave & W Armitage Ave)

tips.text: Enjoy $3 tapas at the bar from 4–6 PM daily, as well as 10-midnight on Fridays and Saturdays.

formattedAddress: 2568 N Clark St (at W Wrightwood Ave)

tips.text: Melds Korean street grub with Mexican ingredients to provide a delicious car crash of flavors. Dumplings, banh mi-style sandwiches & contemporary takes on tacos will be featured on the menu.

location.crossStreet: btwn N California & W Fullerton Ave
formattedAddress: 2323 N Milwaukee Ave (btwn N California & W Fullerton Ave)

tips.text: Located in trendy Logan Square, Revolution Brewing is one of Chicago’s artisanal brewing companies. Try the Bacon Fat Popcorn at their restaurant, which also has vegan-friendly options.

formattedAddress: 2657 N Kedzie Ave (at W Schubert Ave)

tips.text: Logan Square's gastropub, with a kick-ass whisky selection, has made national headlines and even got a Michelin star. Like a nose-to-tail approach? So does chef Jared Wentworth. [Eater 38 Member]

formattedAddress: 820 W Randolph St (at N Green St)

tips.text: Will the combination of Stephanie Izard, rooftop deck and spinning, illuminated goat cause the universe to explode? http://tmout.us/lKTEo

formattedAddress: 800 W Randolph St (at S Halsted St)

tips.text: The generous schmear of mayo, the melted American cheese and the chopped raw onions that cut through the beef with a piquant bite are the real stars of this burger. http://tmoutchi.us/YmTIHi
This is the largest science museum in the Western Hemisphere. The Henry Crown Space Center features rockets, shuttles, satellites, rovers and probes. You can even see the actual Apollo 8 spacecraft!

location.crossStreet: btwn Lake Shore Dr & Columbus Dr
formattedAddress: 337 E Randolph Dr (btwn Lake Shore Dr & Columbus Dr)

tips.text: Sorry, dog lovers, leave your pup at home. In the winter, bring your skates and tackle the skating ribbon (or rent them). Even on the opening day Saturday, not too crowded.❄️👍

formattedAddress: 53 E Randolph St (btwn Wabash Ave & Garland Ct)

tips.text: Thought you’d want to know: Intelligentsia has been nominated for Best Local Coffee Roaster in Time Out Chicago’s 2011 Eat Out Awards. Vote now!

formattedAddress: 1927 W North Ave (at N Winchester Ave)

tips.text: The crispy pies hold a lot of weight, so after you choose your pizza style—red, white or New Haven plain—start picking toppings. (If you’re really going New Haven–style, try one with clams and bacon.)

formattedAddress: 21 E Hubbard St (at N Wabash Ave)

tips.text: In celebration of its 25th anniversary, they will be slinging 25-cent oysters at its River North & Schamburg locations. This deal is available the last Monday of every month in 2010 from 3 - 6pm.

formattedAddress: 449 N Clark St (at W Illinois St)

tips.text: Rick Bayless' counter spot specializes in tortas (think Mexican sandwiches), churros, and after 3:00 p.m., incomparable caldos—soups filled with short ribs, pork carnitas, or wood-roasted chicken.
